meanings.definition: Not able to be saved or improved.
meanings.sent1: The old, torn book was unredeemable and beyond repair.
meanings.sent2: The broken vase was unredeemable, no matter how much glue was used.
meanings.sent3: The student's unredeemable attempt at painting the sunset left the art teacher speechless.
meanings.sent4: Her unredeemable mistake in the play caused the audience to gasp in shock.
meanings.sent5: The unredeemable damage to the car made it impossible to drive.

meanings.definition: Not able to be exchanged for money or goods.
meanings.sent1: The expired coupon was unredeemable at the store.
meanings.sent2: The damaged gift card was unredeemable for any products.
meanings.sent3: His unredeemable attempt to barter with the vendor left him empty-handed.
meanings.sent4: The unredeemable ticket could not be used for entry to the event.
meanings.sent5: The unredeemable voucher was useless at the restaurant.

meanings.definition: Not able to be forgiven or absolved.
meanings.sent1: The criminal's heinous actions were unredeemable in the eyes of the law.
meanings.sent2: The betrayal was so severe that it was deemed unredeemable by the group.
meanings.sent3: Her unredeemable excuse for missing the meeting left her colleagues puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The unredeemable lie shattered the trust between the friends.
meanings.sent5: The unredeemable sin weighed heavily on his conscience.
